intro: Senecio iochanensis, commonly known as the KwaZulu-Natal Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
